attributes.action: Take decisive action against the RMT strike organizers
attributes.additional_details: The workers’ rights must not come at the expense of millions of Londoners and the city’s prosperity. We urgently demand Parliament to hold the RMT union accountable for the ongoing London Underground strike that has paralysed the city, harmed millions, and caused an estimated £230 million economic loss (that's 700,000 lost working days). Immediate measures are needed to prevent further damage, restore normal city life and prevent such disruptions from happening in the future.
attributes.background: We, the residents of London, express our strong discontent and firm condemnation of the ongoing strike by the Rail, Maritime and Transport (RMT) union members working in the London Underground. We call for fines and legal action against the union's organizers responsible for this disruption.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
